title: Why do some people never buy a new car?
self_text: I was just reading an article about the average cost of owning a car and it got me thinking.  I know that most cars depreciate in value, but why would someone ever buy a new car?  It seems like such a waste of money to pay more for something that will immediately lose so much value.  I'm not saying that buying a new car is bad, but I don't understand the appeal when you can get a perfectly good used car for less than what a new car costs.

title: Can you change your character’s name in the game?
self_text: Yes, but only once! This is a long process and takes about an hour to complete.  You have to wait until the start of a new season and then go to the town called “The Forgotten Town” and find a small room where the name changer will be located. You’ll need to get there by using a teleport scroll. If you don’t know where the teleport scrolls are, they can be found in the world map.  Once you’re in the room, talk to the NPC who gives you the ability to change your name. The cost to change your name is 5000 souls.

title: How do I get my credit card information to work with my Apple Pay account?
self_text: So, I was able to add my credit card to Apple Pay last week and everything worked perfectly until I tried to make a purchase today. When I tried to use Apple Pay at the register, it wouldn't let me complete the transaction because of an issue with my card. I went back to Apple settings, found my card, and refreshed the payment method in Apple Pay. It seemed like it worked, but when I went to buy something else online or in person, it didn't work again. This happened again today! I contacted my bank and they told me that there's no problem with my card, so I figured it must be on the Apple side.  I then called Apple Support and they said that the issue is actually with my payment profile in Apple Pay, and that I should update my card info there. However, the website won't allow me to update my card info; I'm being redirected to my bank's website, which doesn't offer the option to update Apple Pay details.  I know that I shouldn't have assumed that Apple would handle my credit card information after adding it to Apple Pay. However, I don't understand why I can't simply change the card number or CVV through Apple Pay itself. I'd like to know if anyone else has experienced this issue before and how you were able to resolve it. I also want to know if there's anything I can do to fix this issue myself. Thanks for your help!

I'm moving forward on my own terms and want to make sure I don't end up back where I was.  I'm selling everything and moving away. This isn't easy, but it feels right for me. I wanted to share because I feel like I'm finally being true to myself. If anyone wants to know more about my situation, please reach out. Thank you for listening.

title: Best way to deal with a player who's not following the rules? (Specifically, ignoring instructions and just doing what they want)
self_text: I've been running a small group of players on a home campaign for awhile now, and we all have fun and it works out well. However, there is one player that consistently ignores the instructions, even after being told repeatedly. It’s not malicious or disruptive, but it makes it difficult to run the game in a way that everyone enjoys.  I’m trying to find the best approach here, so let me know if you think my current approach isn’t correct.   The situation is as follows: We’re playing D&D 5e, and I use the standard “DM instruction” method of telling players how to do something. Like, “You need to open the chest.” The player will say, “Okay!” then immediately tries to pick up the chest without opening it. Now, I tell them again, “You can’t just pick up the chest, you need to open it first,” and they’ll still try to pick it up. This happens every single time. The thing is, the player never argues about it, just does whatever they want.  My thoughts are: 1. Let them do what they want. If they fail, fine, then they get penalized.  2. Stop telling them what to do. Just let them try and see what happens.  3. Make sure they understand why they shouldn’t do something before letting them do it.  4. Tell them again, more forcefully, until they comply.  5. Ask another player to remind them.  6. Call them out publicly when they ignore instructions, making them feel bad for breaking the flow of the game.  7. End the session early and tell them to come back next time if they don’t listen.  8. Ban them from the campaign.  9. Re-evaluate the entire campaign to avoid dealing with them at all.  I've tried options 1-8, but nothing seems to work. The player just keeps ignoring my instructions.  How would you handle this? How should I approach this situation? Are there any specific techniques that might help me to influence this player's behavior? Any suggestions are appreciated!

title: Where can I find the best deals on a used car?
self_text: I'm trying to buy a car for my daughter and need some advice, where is the best place to look for deals and which dealerships are reputable?

title: I’m thinking about making a new account for the next game.
self_text: I recently made an account and got banned, not sure why.  Do you guys think it’s worth making a new account?  Is it likely to happen again?

title: Are there any good ways to get a free copy of the game?
self_text: I’ve been playing since launch and it’s really great, but my friend got me hooked on it recently and now he wants to play too. He doesn't have enough money for the game so I was wondering if there were any legal ways to get him a free copy (or at least cheap).  He loves building stuff in games, so anything with that might appeal to him.

title: How do you change the color of a car in Forza Horizon 5?
self_text: Is it through paint jobs, or just changing the color of the car itself?

title: Best way to transfer files between two phones on Android?
self_text: I have a new phone and would like to transfer all of my photos/videos from my old phone to the new one. What are some ways to do this?  I'm not really looking for cloud solutions or anything too complicated. Just something that is fast, reliable, and doesn't involve a lot of effort.

title: Can I have two jobs?
self_text: Can I work for a company and still be employed by another company at the same time? If so, are there any laws or contracts that might stop me?

title: How to manage your finances during a pandemic?
self_text: I was wondering if anyone has any tips for managing my finances during this pandemic. I'm looking for advice on how to save money, and also what financial assistance is available. Any help would be appreciated!

title: Looking for some advice on how to get a better credit score.
self_text: I have recently been denied a loan and am wondering what i can do to improve my credit score, any help would be appreciated!

title: Is there a way to get money from the bank?
self_text: Yes, I know there's a whole thing about interest rates and things like that but my question is more along the lines of how do you actually get your money back? Do they just send it to you or do you have to take something out of the account?

title: What's the best way to manage money for a small business owner?
self_text: I'm trying to learn about financial planning but there is so much information out there and it can be overwhelming.  I've started my own small business selling handmade crafts online. I make between $50-200 per month on average. I don't have any debt other than my bank account balance. I also don't get paid anything from my business, I just use the revenue to buy more supplies.   What are some good ways to track my finances, what should I do with excess profits, how do I budget, etc.?

title: How do I transfer my credits from the previous game?
self_text: Hi all,  I was wondering how to transfer my credits between games because I played the original game in 2008 and had a lot of credits so I can start off with something when playing the new one. Is there any way for me to do that? Thanks!

title: How much is the cost of a new Apple iPhone 14 Pro?
self_text: I just checked out online and it's $1099, but I am looking for an estimate on how much that would be if I went into an Apple store or through carrier (Verizon, AT&T, T-Mobile)?  I want to get a sense of what the total price would include (taxes, fees, etc.).  Thanks!

title: Can I pay for a new car with my credit card?
self_text: Is there any way to do it without paying interest, or is there an upper limit on how much you can put down?

title: Best way to backup data from a pc that's broken?
self_text: My PC is dead, the screen has died and I can't turn it on anymore.  I need to get all of my files off of the computer before it completely dies but I don't have another computer to transfer them too.  What do I do?

self_text: I have recently got into modding games and decided that I want to set up my own dedicated server with a custom ping so it runs more smoothly in my area. Can anyone give me some advice or tutorials on where to start?

self_text: I am trying to make my own discord bot that has commands that can be triggered by voice chat but I have no idea where to start and need help with how to do it. I'm just starting out in Discord Bots so any advice would be appreciated!

title: How do I play my own world in Skyrim?
self_text: I'm just curious if it's possible to make a map and load up your own world into the game, or is that something only mods can do?  I was hoping to be able to create my own area of interest (like a city) and then be able to travel there at will.  Is that possible or am I completely off base here?

title: Is it possible to make more money by selling an item on Reddit and then buying the same item?
self_text: I saw a video about someone buying things off of Reddit, then reselling them on eBay for profit. This is something that I'm really interested in doing as well. It sounds like there would be some pretty good profits to be made if you do your research right.  I was just wondering what people thought.  Any tips or tricks would also be appreciated!

title: What’s the best way to deal with multiple pings in a server? (For game developers)
self_text: I know it can be tricky and that there are solutions, but I was wondering what you guys do in your games when dealing with players that have high ping? Do you implement some kind of workaround like lag compensation? Or do you just leave it as is?   I'm also curious on how you handle this in different situations. Like, if a player has really bad latency, does it affect their input or something? Are they still able to play the game?  Let me know!

title: What are the most popular game genres for PC? (I'm looking to buy a new computer)
self_text: Hi everyone, I'm looking to buy a new pc and want to know which games are popular in what genres so that I can get something with good performance.  So far, I have heard a lot about Cyberpunk 2077, Baldur's Gate 3, Diablo IV and Elden Ring but I would like to know what other games people play and enjoy.  Thanks!
